mapper.sql: logid, userid, logindate, logintime, loginpasswd, loginip, logintype, loginresult
mapper.insert: insert into sys_log_login (logid, userid, logindate, logintime, loginpasswd, loginip, logintype, loginresult) values (#{logid, jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{userid, jdbcType=DECIMAL}, #{logindate, jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{logintime, jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{loginpasswd, jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{loginip, jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{logintype, jdbcType=INTEGER}, #{loginresult, jdbcType=INTEGER})

insert all
into sys_log_login (logid, userid, logindate, logintime, loginpasswd, loginip, logintype, loginresult) values (#{item.logid, jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{item.userid, jdbcType=DECIMAL}, #{item.logindate, jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{item.logintime, jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{item.loginpasswd, jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{item.loginip, jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{item.logintype, jdbcType=INTEGER}, #{item.loginresult, jdbcType=INTEGER})
select 1 from dual
mapper.delete: delete from sys_log_login where 1=1 and logid = #{0}
mapper.update: update sys_log_login set userid = #{userid, jdbcType=DECIMAL}, logindate = #{logindate, jdbcType=VARCHAR}, logintime = #{logintime, jdbcType=VARCHAR}, loginpasswd = #{loginpasswd, jdbcType=VARCHAR}, loginip = #{loginip, jdbcType=VARCHAR}, logintype = #{logintype, jdbcType=INTEGER}, loginresult = #{loginresult, jdbcType=INTEGER} where 1=1 and logid = #{logid, jdbcType=VARCHAR}

update sys_log_login
userid = #{userid, jdbcType=DECIMAL},
logindate = #{logindate, jdbcType=VARCHAR},
logintime = #{logintime, jdbcType=VARCHAR},
loginpasswd = #{loginpasswd, jdbcType=VARCHAR},
loginip = #{loginip, jdbcType=VARCHAR},
logintype = #{logintype, jdbcType=INTEGER},
loginresult = #{loginresult, jdbcType=INTEGER},
where 1=1 and logid = #{logid, jdbcType=VARCHAR}
